item.title: P2P Kredite Forum:Re: Neues Kreditunternehmen Nera Capital (UK) (Mintos) #mintos @Mintos #p2plending
item.description:
Claus Lehmann
Statement von Nera Capital

Zitat:
Hi everyone, It is great to see that there is a lot of interest around the Supreme Court judgment released on Friday evening, and I wanted to clarify for investors specifically, this ruling does not impact your existing investments. The outcome does not affect any loans or claims currently funded via the platform. That said, it’s an exciting time for Nera Capital as a company. The judgment helps shape future market opportunities, and we’re pleased to share that the outcome aligns with the areas we’ve deliberately focused on. While our approach may have been viewed as cautious, we’ve consistently targeted claims involving clear breaches of FCA regulations — particularly around discretionary commission arrangements (DCAs) and lenders’ failure to conduct proper affordability assessments. The Supreme Court reviewed three claims. Only the Johnson case brought under the unfair relationship provisions of the Consumer Credit Act was successful, with the court confirming the borrower’s right to full redress, including all commissions and interest. The other two cases, which were not based on that legal framework, were dismissed. Importantly, these types of claims are not ones that Nera supports — further reinforcing that this judgment does not affect our current portfolio. This outcome validates the strategy we’ve taken from the beginning. We continue to see strong institutional interest and backing for this approach, and we’re excited about the road ahead. Thank you for your continued interest and thoughtful questions — even though the ruling doesn’t apply to your investments directly, it’s encouraging to see such engagement with the broader legal and regulatory landscape. Deborah.
Quelle Telegram
